author: Diario de Burgos
title: 'Super Mario' Hezonja deja tocado al Baskonia de Laso
text: Baloncesto - Euroliga 'Super Mario' Hezonja deja tocado al Baskonia de Laso Europa Press - jueves, 23 de enero de 2025 90 Real Madrid 89 Baskonia El equipo blanco llama al 'Top 6' y aleja a los vascos de los 'playoffs' con un triple sobre la bocina del croata en el duelo español de Euroliga 'Super Mario' Hezonja deja tocado al Baskonia de Laso - Foto: JUANJO MARTIN El Real Madrid doblegó (90-89) al Baskonia este jueves en la jornada 23 de la Euroliga celebrada en el Movistar Arena de la capital, un choque igualado que fue por barrios y estuvo en el aire hasta el último segundo, cuando entró el triple ganador de Mario Hezonja que iguala a los blancos con el 'Top 6' de la tabla.El regreso de Pablo Laso a la que fue su casa 11 temporadas, como ya hizo el año pasado con el Bayern y esta vez con otro equipo español, se saldó con una derrota de las que escuecen. El Baskonia enseñó sus brotes verdes y el Madrid, pese a la derrota la semana pasada ante Olympiacos, también tuvo argumentos ante su público.El rebote ofensivo, 21 cazaron los visitantes en el aro rival, dio más vidas que un gato a los vascos, que firmaron un parcial de 0-13 en los últimos tres minutos para acariciar un triunfo muy necesario además de prestigioso. Sin embargo, la defensa blanca volvió a tiempo y Hezonja, máximo anotador junto a Facundo Campazzo (22 puntos), resolvió: 13 triunfos para los de Chus Mateo y 9 para un Baskonia que se aleja del 'play-in'.'Super Mario' Hezonja deja tocado al Baskonia de Laso - Foto: JUANJO MARTINEl partido fue entretenido y con ritmo ya en la primera parte, donde hubo más intercambio de golpes que buenas defensas. De menos a más, el Baskonia se fue por delante al descanso (42-45), aunque el Madrid parecía ir más a fuego lento, cada uno con sus armas.Los blancos marcaron territorio con Edy Tavares, Facundo Campazzo y Dzanan Musa, pero el gigante de Cabo Verde descansó en el segundo cuarto y el Baskonia se animó pisar la pintura. Por contra, los vascos tuvieron que jugar muchos minutos sin Markus Howard por sus dos faltas tempranas tras un prometedor inicio.Los de Laso cambiaron también el signo del rebote y, aunque Hezonja irrumpió para los blancos en el pique con Luka Samanic, la ventaja pasó a ser azulgrana. El Baskonia, de negro en el Palacio madrileño, contó también con el uno contra uno de Trent Forrest y las soluciones que ofreció Nikolaos Rogkavopoulos.'Super Mario' Hezonja deja tocado al Baskonia de LasoAsí, la balanza se fue decantando del lado visitante camino a los vestuarios, con margen de mejora sobre todo en defensa. La segunda mitad cambió la inercia hacia los blancos con ese punto más de intensidad, con Hezonja, el regreso de Tavares y Campazzo, pero el Baskonia respondió con Moneke y el acierto de Rogkavopoulos.Los de Laso tuvieron también su momento, con Howard de vuelta al parqué, con Moneke siempre por medio y Forrest (56-61). Las pinturas de guerra en defensa que pedía el partido se las puso Alberto Abalde en los locales, en un nuevo giro desde los banquillos, con Laso midiéndose al que fue muchos años su entrenador ayudante. Baskonia aguantó por delante al último cuarto, pero el Madrid siguió apretando con Howard anulado y una buena renta en el 81-75.A partir de ahí, el último trance de Rogkavopoulos, que terminó en 22 puntos, supuso un parcial de 0-13 con el que los vascos tuvieron la victoria en su mano. Le entró a la sexta el triple a Moneke pero no mató el Baskonia con Luka Samanic, ni tampoco desde la línea de personal. El Madrid, experto en milagros, se aferró al encuentro y lo ganó sobre la bocina con Hezonja. , , , , , ,

author: Redazione
title: Schlein “La destra vuole una sanitá a misura di portafoglio”
text: ROMA (ITALPRESS) – “Meloni sono giorni che dá i numeri sulla sanitá. Dice ‘abbiamo aumentato i fondi’ e in termini assoluti é vero, ma é quello che potrebbe dire qualsiasi premier perché in termine assoluti é vero per tutti. Ma se si guarda la spesa sanitaria sul Pil é scesa. Meloni dice che le fa ridere che si calcoli la spesa in base al Pil ma si fa cosí in tutto il mondo, quelli che piangono peró sono gli italiani. Siamo ai minimi storici degli ultimi 15 anni tanto che milioni di persone hanno rinunciato a curarsi. La destra abbia il coraggio di dire agli italiani che vuole una sanitá a misura del portafoglio, in cui chi ha i soldi salta la lista d’attesa di un anno e mezzo e va dal privato. Il problema é che chi quei soldi non ce li ha sta rinunciando a curarsi. Il primo effetto della manovra presentata ieri é stato la proclamazione dello sciopero dei medici, noi saremo al loro fianco a sostenerli”. Cosí la segretaria del Pd, Elly Schlein, ospite a “Diritto e Rovescio” su Rete 4. Sull’aumento delle pensioni minime “al al di lá degli annunci roboanti, ieri sono usciti i numeri: si tratta di un aumento di 3 euro. Allora, lo dico con rispetto, ma le persone che non riescono a pagare le bollette, che sono le piú care d’Europa e su questo il governo non sta facendo nulla, cosa se ne fanno di 10 centesimi al giorno?”, ha aggiunto. Per la segretaria dem l’accordo con l’Albania “non sta in piedi dal punto di vista giuridico e politico. A nostro avviso é inumano perché viola i diritti fondamentali delle persone. Hanno appena buttato 800 milioni degli italiani per costruire centri e deportarci delle persone, per poi scoprire di doverle riportare addirittura indietro. Basta con la propaganda, serve un approccio molto piú serio”. (ITALPRESS). -Foto: Agenzia Fotogramma- ads/red 24-Ott-24 21:47

author: Elliott Teaford
title: Do the Chargers have an advantage in a battle of backup QBs?
text:
COSTA MESA — The matchup looked pretty good when the NFL schedule was announced way back in May. But that was before the Chargers nosedived to the bottom of the AFC West with losses in six of seven games and then the Denver Broncos appeared to toss in the towel on their season.
Justin Herbert and the Chargers, healthy and playing at peak efficiency, facing Russell Wilson and the Broncos, healthy and playing at peak efficiency, seemed like a delicious late-season grudge match. But then Herbert got hurt and Wilson got benched and, sorry folks, there will be no ticket refunds.
Easton Stick will make his third consecutive start in place of Herbert, who suffered a season-ending right index finger fracture in the
Chargers’ loss to the Broncos on Dec. 10 at SoFi Stadium. Jarrett Stidham will replace Wilson, who was benched by Denver coach Sean Payton this week.
Stick is 0-2 so far.
Stidham is 0-0, having played only once in a relief appearance earlier this month.
Advantage, Chargers?
Stick has made progress since being thrust into the lineup late in the first half of the Chargers’ 24-7 loss to the Broncos, after Herbert injured his finger after he was hit as he completed a pass. No question, Stick improved from the Chargers’
63-21 loss to the Las Vegas Raiders to their 24-22 loss to the Buffalo Bills.
“I think you get better every single rep you take – that’s the goal, at least,” said Stick, who has completed 66.3% of his passes for 651 yards with three touchdowns and one interception in place of Herbert. “I’ve really enjoyed being in the huddle with the guys. Communicating, getting lined up and going to play.
“It’s been a lot of fun. I think we’ve gotten better over the last two weeks. We’ll just try to clean up some little things and, hopefully, go play really well on Sunday.”
No question, the Chargers (5-10) have failed to get the desired results during their season-defining slide, which
prompted the Dec. 15 firing of Brandon Staley as coach and Tom Telesco as general manager. But the Chargers have continued to play and root for each other in this lost season.
Stick endeared himself to his teammates and coaches with a determination that showed itself daily as Herbert’s backup and again when he finally got a chance to make his first NFL start after four-plus seasons. They admired the way he shook off their historic loss to the Raiders as easily as a hard tackle.
The Chargers especially admired his toughness when he scrambled for a 21-yard gain in the third quarter against the Bills this past Saturday, declining to slide safely but taking on a pair of Buffalo tacklers to advance the ball to the 17-yard line. Stick’s run set up Cameron Dicker’s 40-yard field goal.
The Chargers’ bench went into a frenzy.
It might not have been the smartest play, but it inspired his teammates.
“Yeah, we’d prefer a slide, but he had some adrenaline there, so he went for it,” Chargers offensive coordinator Kellen Moore said. “It’s a slippery slope. You want to let the guys play, but you have to be smart about it. (Running) is a piece of Easton’s game that he has utilized and he’s doing a really good job with it.”
Stick ran around the right end for a 1-yard touchdown in the second quarter, the Chargers’ only touchdown in their loss to the Bills. He was the Chargers’ second-leading rusher with 25 yards on seven attempts, trailing only running back Austin Ekeler, who had 65 yards on 15 carries.
Stick also completed 23 of 33 passes for 210 yards against Buffalo.
The individual statistics were meaningless, as far as he was concerned, though.
“Just trying to win,” Stick said. “You put everything into this game. When you do that, obviously, there’s a ton of pride. This matters to a lot of people, especially in this building, it matters a lot. We’re going out there to get better on the field here and go out on Sunday to win.”

author: Franco Jose C. Baroña
title: 2023 a good year for PH peace process | The Manila Times
text:
THE administration of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has achieved much this year in ending the decades-long armed conflict in the country, said Presidential Adviser on the Peace Process Carlito Galvez.
"Major milestones have been achieved in the comprehensive Philippine peace process under the Marcos administration's Five-Point Peace, Reconciliation and Unity agenda," Galvez said, as he delivered the year-end report of the Office of the Presidential Adviser on Peace Reconciliation and Unity.
Presidential Peace Adviser Carlito Galvez Jr. Presidential Peace Adviser Carlito Galvez Jr. Among the achievements he mentioned was the passing of the Bangsamoro Parliament of five of its seven priority codes, which aim to improve the socioeconomic conditions of its people and boost the region's economy.
These include the Administrative Code, Civil Service Code, Electoral Code, Local Government Code, and Education Code.
Galvez said this was an indication that the Bangsamoro Transition Authority has gotten stronger, noting that all seven mechanisms of the National Government-Bangsamoro Government Intergovernmental Relations Body (IGRB) have been functioning.

organizations.name: office of the presidential adviser on peace reconciliation and unity

author: Momen Zellmi
title: Pakistan and Iran Agree to De-escalate Tensions: A Step Towards Regional Stability
text:
Escalating Cross-Border Conflict: Pakistan Strikes Baluchi Forces in Iran
Pakistan and Iran Agree to De-escalate Tensions: A Step Towards Regional Stability
In a pivotal move, Pakistan and Iran have agreed to de-escalate tensions following reciprocal air strikes. The conflict was ignited when armed militants, part of a terrorist group, launched an attack from Iranian territory into Pakistan’s Balochistan province, causing multiple casualties among Pakistani soldiers. This act of aggression prompted Pakistan to retaliate with air strikes on the militants’ hideouts in Iran, marking the onset of a cycle of retaliatory strikes.
Dialogues and Decisions
The escalating situation drew international attention and stirred concerns over a broader conflict in an already volatile region. High-level contacts between Islamabad and Tehran, including a phone conversation between the foreign ministers of both countries, led to the agreement to de-escalate the situation. The dialogue highlighted the importance of cooperation and open communication to tackle security challenges. It also echoed the shared vow of both nations to act against terrorist groups operating in the border region.
Strengthening Border Security
The agreement further includes robust measures to fortify border security and prevent the future use of either country’s territory by militants for cross-border attacks. The shared commitment to neutralize and destroy terrorist camps in Pakistan signifies a step towards building mutual trust and working towards regional peace and stability.
International Reception
The international community has welcomed this move, with hopes pinned on reducing tensions and promoting peace in the region. The situation has underscored the necessity of restraint and diplomacy in the face of potential crisis escalation. It is hoped that this move will not only alleviate regional tensions but also set a precedent for peaceful conflict resolution in the future.

author: Diego Bastarrica
title: Vaya problema: Word está sufriendo problemas graves al escribir - Digital Trends Español
text:
Digital Trends Español Un problema gravísimo está afectando a algunos usuarios con el popular procesador de textos de Microsoft Office : Word . Esto porque una actualización de Windows generó un error al escribir.
Después de actualizar a la versión 2407 (compilación 17830.20138) o posterior, puede encontrarse con que Outlook, Word o OneNote pueden cerrarse inesperadamente al escribir o realizar otras tareas de creación, como la revisión ortográfica.
Recommended Videos Una confirmación del error podría estar en el registro de aplicaciones del Visor de eventos de Windows para el evento 1000 o el evento 1001 y los detalles del evento siguiente: Nombre de la aplicación con errores: OUTLOOK.EXE, versión: 16.0.17830.20138, marca de tiempo: 0x66aaad8c Nombre del módulo con errores: mscss7it.dll, versión: 16.0.12527.20122, marca de tiempo: 0x5e439ea1 Código de excepción: 0xc 5 Desplazamiento con errores: 0x 3e518 Id. del proceso con errores: 0x0x51B0 Hora de inicio de la aplicación con errores: 0x0x1DAE97DD89190C3
Esto específicamente está precedido de una actualización de los paquetes de idiomas de Word, y de los demás programas. Donde idiomas como italiano o alemán están provocando fallos.
Cómo solucionar la falla de Word Outlook y Los equipos de Office están investigando el problema.
Para resolver el problema, haga lo siguiente:
Realice una reparación en línea de la aplicación de Office, Reparar una aplicación de Office . Desinstala y vuelve a instalar el paquete de idioma, consulta «Paso 2: Configurar el idioma de Microsoft 365», Paquete accesorio de idioma para Microsoft 365 . Recomendaciones del editor Google está reparando un grave problema en Android TV Esta actualización de iPhone arregla problema grave de Apple Pay Cómo Word ha cambiado en 40 años la forma en que escribimos El grave error al estilo GOT de The Last of Us capítulo 6 WordPress: millones de sitios reciben parche por falla crítica

author: Nina Zdinjak
title: Ground Cannabis Dust Is A Hazardous Chemical, Confirms Massachusetts Regulator - Trulieve Cannabis (OTC:TCNNF) - Benzinga
text:
The Massachusetts Cannabis Control Commission issued new recommendations Wednesday through a bulletin designed to improve workplace health and safety at marijuana processing facilities and broadly across the legal industry.
The announcement represents the Commission's formal recognition of ground cannabis dust as a hazardous chemical that can irritate the respiratory system and exposed skin and marks a major step towards updating Massachusetts' workplace safety expectations following the 2022 occupational asthma death of a Holyoke processing facility employee .
"Today's bulletin is intended to bring increased awareness of an identified health risk in the marijuana industry and will support Commission and industry efforts to enhance safety standards across Massachusetts," stated commission acting executive director/chief people officer Debbie Hilton-Creek . "We will continue to partner with licensees to appropriately and effectively communicate this message and depend on them to implement protocols that will protect the overall well-being of our workforce."
Under the new bulletin, the Commission recommends that all licensees engaged in marijuana processing follow Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) guidelines around hazardous chemicals in the workplace. The Commission also reminds licensees of its obligation to have a hazard communication program which includes the evaluation of hazardous chemicals in its facility and develop Safety Data Sheets to inform its employees.
Going forward, the Commission is advising licensees engaged in marijuana processing to protect employees from hazards associated with cannabis dust exposure by using engineering controls like local exhaust ventilation, plus administrative controls like limiting employee exposure during the workday. The Commission recommends that licensees provide personal protective equipment, and appropriately manage medical situations when they arise.
What Happened : On Jan. 4, 2022, Lorna McMurrey (27) complained she could not breathe, presumably due to cannabis kief (cannabis dust) in the air where she was grinding and packaging pre-rolls. She was taken to a local hospital where she died on Jan. 7. According to the report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), this was the first known case of an occupational asthma death in the U.S. cannabis industry. The report confirmed that the occupational asthma was triggered by ground cannabis dust, and revealed that cannabis giant Trulieve TCNNF committed three “serious” violations assessed by OSHA for which it paid fines totaling $35,219.
In June, the Commission fined medical marijuana giant Trulieve TCNNF in relation to the death of a company’s employee in 2022. A company representative signed a tentative settlement with Commission, agreeing to a fine in the amount of $350,000.
Read Also: Mother Of Deceased Cannabis Worker Sues Marijuana Giant Claiming Wrongful Death And Negligence
Get Benzinga's exclusive analysis and the top news about the cannabis industry and markets daily in your inbox for free. Subscribe to our newsletter here . If you're serious about the business, you can't afford to miss out.
Safety And Sanitary Standards Today's update follows a state Department of Public Health (DPH) Fatality Assessment and Control Evaluation (FACE) report and Occupational Lung Disease Bulletin that were issued following McMurrey's death.
As the first confirmed case of occupational asthma in a cannabis facility, the CDC report said the incident "illustrates missed opportunities for prevention, including control of workplace exposures, medical surveillance, and treatment according to current asthma guidelines."
The previous DPH report also included recommendations for marijuana cannabis processors, including training all employees about how to work safely around hazardous materials, developing comprehensive health and safety programs, and monitoring employees for health symptoms.
The Commission's latest announcement relative to cannabis dust follows a February bulletin that advised licensees about new safety and sanitary standards for processing the leaves and flowers of female marijuana plants in a way that is:
Well cured and free from seeds and stems; Free of dirt, sand, debris, and other foreign matter; Free of contamination by mold, rot, other fungus, pests and bacterial diseases and satisfying the sanitation requirements in 105 CMR 500.000, and if applicable, 105 CMR 590.000: State Sanitary Code Chapter X – Minimum Sanitation Standards for Food Establishments; Prepared and handled on food-grade stainless steel tables with no contact with Licensees' or Marijuana Establishment Agents' bare hands; and Packaged in a secure area. Commission's new bulletin clarifies that all licensees engaged in the processing of marijuana have a separate obligation to ensure the safety of workers, and all marijuana establishments and medical marijuana treatment centers in Massachusetts are required to follow Commission regulations that require written workplace safety and health standard operating procedures.
